title: UQRUG
text:
The University of Queensland R Users Group
UQRUG is a gathering for R users of all skills, to help each other solve problems, to share resources and tips, and to simply hang out with a nice community.

title: Upcoming Events
text:
We’ve pushed back this month’s UQRUG to December 7th due to clashes with end of year events.
Our main purpose is to serve as a drop-in help session for help with R and RStudio, but to keep things interesting we will briefly highlight a useful tool, function or package each week.
This week Nick will be briefly going over creating animated and interactive plots in R using the packages gganimate and plotly.

   

When Wednesday 7th December, 12 - 2pm
Where St Lucia, Duhig North Central Library (12), Training room 12-N109, and on Zoom
Sign up to the next event on the Library training page
For more information, reach out to the UQ Library training team: training@library.uq.edu.au

title: Community Groups
text:
R-Ladies Brisbane welcomes members of all R proficiency levels. The community is designed to develop our members’ R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community!
    When: Find their events on MeetUP
    Where: Online and in Person.
    More Details: The R Ladies Brisbane GitHub

title: Community Groups
section: UQ GeoSpatial Analysis Community of Practice
text:
UQ GeoSpatial Analysis Community of Practice








A monthly geospatial skill sharing tutorial sessions where a member of the community shares their skills, experiences and tricks in a friendly and inclusive environment.
    When: The last Thursday of the month, 2:30pm–4:30pm (AEST)
    Where: Online. For meeting details please email Mitch at mitchel.rudge@uq.edu.au
    More Details: The UQ GeoSpatial Analysis Community website

title: Community Groups
text:
QUT/UQ Office Hours








For Australian researchers working with linguistics, text analytics, digital and computational methods, social media and web archives to bring their technical questions, research problems and rough ideas and get advice and feedback.
    When: Fortnightly on Tuesdays, 2pm–3pm AEDT (1pm AEST).
    Where: Online. For Zoom meeting details please register to attend here.
    More Details: The Australian Digital Observatory website.

title: Community Groups
text:
Hacky Hour UQ








For UQ researchers to get support with research-related technical issues.
    When: Weekly on Tuesdays, 3pm–4pm (AEST)
    Where: Online. For Zoom meeting details please email rcc-support@uq.edu.au
    More Details: The RCC Hacky Hour UQ website

title: Untitled
text:
owid %>% 
  group_by(country) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, 
             y=co2)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity") +
    geom_label(aes(x = 1980, y = 28000, label = "This is fine"))

Warning: Removed 15174 rows containing missing values (`position_stack()`).

title: February 22th UQRUG Drop-in + Forms with Shiny and Googlesheets4
text:
This week Nick will be briefly going over how to create a customisable online form in R using the googlesheets4 and Shiny packages.

  

When Wednesday 22th February, 12 - 2pm
Where St Lucia, Duhig North Central Library (12), Training room 12-N109, and on Zoom
Sign up to the next event on the Library training page
For more information, reach out to the UQ Library training team for more help: training@library.uq.edu.au

title: March 29th UQRUG Drop-in + Websites with Quarto
text:
Before we jump into our help session for everyone to ask questions, this week Nick will be briefly going over how to create a customisable website or blog in R using the quarto package.
We were considering a spatial session this month, but the Geospatial Community are running an R Spatial session this Thursday March 23rd.

 

When Wednesday 29th March, 12 - 2pm
Where St Lucia, Duhig North Central Library (12), Training room 12-N109, and on Zoom
Sign up to the next event on the Library training page
For more information, reach out to the UQ Library training team for more help: training@library.uq.edu.au

title: December 7th UQRUG Drop-in + Animated and Interactive Plots
text:
This week Nick will be briefly going over creating animated and interactive plots in R using the packages gganimate and plotly.

   

We’ve pushed back this month’s UQRUG to December 7th due to clashes with end of year events.
When Wednesday 7th December, 12 - 2pm
Where St Lucia, Duhig North Central Library (12), Training room 12-N109, and on Zoom
Sign up to the next event on the Library training page
For more information, reach out to the UQ Library training team for more help: training@library.uq.edu.au

title: January 25th UQRUG Drop-in + Dashboard with Flexdashboard
text:
This week Nick will be briefly going over creating quick and easy interactive dashboards to display your data with R using the package flexdashboard (it’s surprisingly straightforward, and uses RMarkdown, so you can export as HTML).

  

When Wednesday 25th January, 12 - 2pm
Where St Lucia, Duhig North Central Library (12), Training room 12-N109, and on Zoom
Sign up to the next event on the Library training page
For more information, reach out to the UQ Library training team for more help: training@library.uq.edu.au
